intro: Aegopogon strictus, commonly known as the narrowleaf goatherb, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows in grasslands, meadows, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellowish-green flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer. Aegopogon strictus is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
